title: VIP: match/case syntax
body:
## Simple Summary
Allow statements of the form
```
match expr:
  case 1:
    ...
  case 2:
    ...
  case _:
    ...
```

## Motivation
It allows cleaner code in certain situations, ex. https://github.com/curvefi/curve-pool-registry/blob/b47173844836187c42724aa4468e984c1abb62e8/contracts/Swaps.vy#L572-L629. It is also available in Python(>=3.10) and people kind of expect it to be available. It also makes it slightly easier to optimize code, since the expr being matched on only needs to be evaluated one time (without any further analysis).

## Specification
TBD

## Backwards Compatibility
Will only work with Python3.10+, unless we switch to our custom parser. For users who are using with Python <3.10, we could conceivably just fail if a match/case statement is detected, and recommend they upgrade.
